definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: The police report described, in horrifying detail, the nightmare that followed.
sentences.chinese: 警方卷宗描述了接下来发生的噩梦，令人战栗的细节。

sentences.english: He was started out of his horrible dream by my ringing.
sentences.chinese: 我给他打电话的铃声，使他从噩梦中惊醒过来。

sentences.english: Even as a kid, I had nightmares of nuclear apocalypse.
sentences.chinese: 即便当我还是个孩子的时候，我会做核灾变的噩梦。

sentences.english: The result is both realistic and hallucinatory.
sentences.chinese: 《和巴什尔跳华尔兹》也是警醒观众的噩梦。

sentences.english: This mental imagery rehearsal by exorcising the fear and finally dispel the nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 这样的心理想象练习可以驱逐恐惧，最终消除噩梦。

sentences.english: Things explode. These are the emergencies and disasters that we have nightmares about.
sentences.chinese: 噩梦般的紧急事件与灾难这样的事情不胜枚举。

sentences.english: Having no fingerprints would really be a nightmare for most of us.
sentences.chinese: 对大多数人来说，没有指纹真的会是一场噩梦。

sentences.english: He woke up from a nightmare, trembling with fear.
sentences.chinese: 他从噩梦中惊醒，因为恐惧而吓得发抖。

sentences.english: Failure is a word that gives students continuous nightmares.
sentences.chinese: “失败”是一个让学生们夜夜做噩梦的词儿。

sentences.english: I have nightmares about plane crashes.
Perhaps it was that sunbeam that had changed my nightmare into a dream of adventure.
sentences.chinese: 可能就是那束阳光，让那场噩梦变成了奇遇。

sentences.english: I feel sleepy. I had nightmare last night.
Wanda had been sleeping in the den ever since she had begun to have nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 婉达自从做噩梦以来一直睡在那小屋里。

definition: to dream/to have a dream/fig. illusion/fantasy/pipe dream
variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
to sleepwalk/to journey in a dream
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
